contacts.alert.import2: The [number] field must have the contact's phone number with country and area codes to work correctly.
contacts.alert.import4: Fields should be separated by commas only.
contacts.alert.import5: You can continue using the system while the import is not finished.

contacts.alert.google.import1: Only contacts that have at least a name and a phone number will be imported.
contacts.alert.google.import2: If there is more than one phone number field in a contact, only one of the numbers will be saved!

textForm.alert.template.noFloatingVariab: There cannot be floating variables (e.g., lines where there are only variables without any text).
textForm.alert.template.variableExample: Example of content with a variable: Hello, {{1}}! How can we assist you today?
textForm.alert.template.lowercaseName: The template name should contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores.
textForm.alert.template.noNonPromotional: There cannot be non-promotional text (not exceeding 1,024 characters).
textForm.alert.template.plainText: Use plain text, which can include alphabet letters, digits, special characters, emojis, and optional WhatsApp formatting (bold, italic, strikethrough, or monospace).

pmessage.workflow.has.confirmation.info: Send a message for the user to confirm the response to proceed to the next step.
pmessage.workflow.await.response.info:
Wait user reply to proceed to next step.
If cleared, the message will be sent and already proceed to next step.
pmessage.workflow.has.multiple.answers.i:
Allows the user to answer this step with multiple messages, instead of just one.
If he finishes answering, a message is sent with a button to continue with the automation
pmessage.workflow.skip.step: Skip step when contact already exists
pmessage.workflow.variables: Tip! You can use the following variables in your messages:
pmessage.workflow.variables2: (The variables for each step will only work when the user answer them)
pmessage.workflow.variables3: (The blue variables are dynamically created according to the number of steps, and the purple one are standard system variables)
pmessage.workflow.disabled.option: Option disabled due to selected integration!
pmessage.glpi.workflow.finish: All right here *#contact_name#*! Your call has been successfully created!

pmessage.glpi.workflow.confirmation.subj: Is the subject of the called *"#step_2#"* correct?

tooltip.learnMore.queue1: The fields below are mandatory for registering a sector in the company.
tooltip.learnMore.queue2: You can choose a color from the color palette that the field provides, or enter the hex code for the color you want.
tooltip.learnMore.whour0: To delete a time, check for messages that use it and unlink it to continue.
tooltip.learnMore.whour1: You need to add a description to create a schedule, schedules with the same description are not allowed.
tooltip.learnMore.whour2: You can select a day and enter the desired times to register a time in the table.
tooltip.learnMore.whour3: The Checkbox field will automatically set All Day and disable fields for editing, disable to change fields.
tooltip.learnMore.whour4: You cannot register days with the same time between them, even if it is at another time, there may be a conflict in sending messages.
tooltip.learnMore.pmessage1: You must have a time and/or a sector created to register a message of the 'Sector' or 'Greeting' type.
tooltip.learnMore.pmessage2: To create Greeting or Sector messages, you need to select a time.
tooltip.learnMore.pmessage3: The message field is mandatory, you can write messages of up to 600 characters.
tooltip.learnMore.pmessage4: The 'Enable message' option enables or disables a message for use (enabled by default).
